result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominick J Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Jail
IF REVOKED 2 days sentence credit

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety, random UA's

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia

Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed

Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed

Cases 22TR2566 and 22TR2567 are dismissed and read in
Full-time employment and/or combination of schooling

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominick J Mueller

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:05 AM
Intern Abigail Kincheloe for the State of Wisconsin
Attorney Mark P Murphy in court for Dominick J Mueller.  
Defendant Dominick J Mueller in court.  
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
Counts 2 is dismissed and read-in.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense requests expunction.  Court denies.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
6 MONTHS JAIL
Credit time 2-days, if Revoked
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
Full-Time employment and/or combination of schooling
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchases used, stored, packaged, or distributed

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Body Armour warnings given.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;  filed by Atty. Mark Murphy
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:03 AM   File not called on the record.
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dominick J Mueller in court by zoom with attorney Mark P Murphy by zoom.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Murphy requests a plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

dated 06-27-2022 from Atty. Mark Murphy, requesting to adjourn the 07-01-2022 hearing;  
  **Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 06-28-2022:  granted - ok to reset
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:29 AM Defendant Dominick J Mueller in court with attorney Mark P Murphy.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 019066,
Payable Number: 464916,
Receipt Number: 22R 020556,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

02:23 PM Defendant Dominick J Mueller in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Herbers appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The defendant is provided with a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
